fields.description:
!image-2019-02-26-08-08-26-184.png!

Who thought this was a good idea? 

Why does the field allow you to add more than 5? 

Why does the 'send' button update to list any amount? 

Why does this error not pop up until AFTER you have wasted your time typing in 50+ email addresses?
fields.summary: Limit on Adding Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Issue layout provides the user with the ability to configure the placement of fields in the right-hand column of new Jira issue view. The issue layout can also provide the users with the flexibility of changing the position of add-ons which appear in the issue view.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include add-ons in the Issue layout setting
fields.summary: Ability to configure the position of add-ons using Issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

First time any status or transition from the diagram is deleted - confirmation to deletion of the status or transition pops-up. Once pop-up is dismissed or confirmed to delete, then the delete button(keyboard) does not work again.
h3. Environment

macOS High Sierra
Google Chrome Version 72.0.3626.109 (64-bit)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # navigate to Jira settings > Issues > Workflows
 # Edit Existing workflow
 # Select any status or transition
 # Press Delete button(from keyboard) and a pop-up or warning appears
 # Confirm the deletion or dismiss the pop-up
 # Press Delete button again on any selected status or transition

h3. Expected Results

The same pop-up appears to confirm or cancel the deletion of the status or transition.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. Neither the status/transition is deleted nor the pop-up appears
fields.summary: Workflow Designer - Delete (keyboard) works only one time

fields.description:
*Update from Atlassian on May 18th*

Hi All, we apologize the delay in bringing this feature into the new view.

Good news - we're starting to slowly roll-out the copy configuration feature to Jira Software customers in upcoming days. As for Jira Service Management users, at this stage, we don't know whether or when we will roll this out pending internal decision on how we want request type and agent view to be displayed

 

For those non-JSW users you can find this feature, which is limited to Jira Admins. To navigate to the screen below: go to you project page -> click project settings -> click issue layout -> click on "edit layout" for one of your layouts -> then you should see the screen below.

Once you clicked Copy Issue Layout button as shown on the screen, you can follow consequent steps in the full screen wizard

 

!Screen Shot 2021-05-18 at 11.32.35 am.png|width=671,height=452!

 

============================================================================

 As a larger organization, we rely heavily on standardized views for issues.

Currently, Jira issue layout is based in part on the screens, however, due to the fact that the issue view screen is largely ignored by the new issue view, this means that the issue layout must be customized for each every project, and a standard view cannot be produced and used.

I would like to propose the option of making the issue layout something that can be copied or shared between projects.
fields.summary: Ability to share Issue layout between projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The [JQL function ProjectsLeadByUser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-765593719.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-projectsLeadByUserprojectsLeadByUser()] accepts as a parameter the username and consequently if we try: 

{code} project in projectsLeadByUser(bill) AND status = Open {code}

We get open issues in projects that are led by User Bill. 

Now that the username is getting deprecated as per [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], we expect that the AccountID value gets accepted as a parameter. 

h3. Expected Results
* Accept AccountID value as parameter. 


h3. Actual Results
* Only username is accepted as parameter. 

h3. Notes
The endpoint "Convert user identifiers to account IDs in JQL queries" POST /rest/api/3/jql/pdcleaner detailed through this [link|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-jql-pdcleaner-post] is also not providing the correct result. 

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround to use the AccountID.
fields.summary: JQL function ProjectsLeadByUser() is not following GDPR changes

fields.description:
When some user is *mentioned* in Jira, Slack receives notification showing the *user name* instead of *display name*.
We would like to change this format of notification and show the *display name* when a user is *mentioned* in Jira.
fields.summary: Show display name instead of user name in Slack mention notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the new issue view and we copy a text that contains images in the body and then paste it as a comment, the attachments are also uploaded but it shows "Fail to load" and if we click on "Save" it shows: Comment could not be updated. 
There was a connection problem and your comment was not successfully updated. Check your network before trying to update or add another comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy text that contains images (we must use CTRL or Command + A) (I used [this one|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-articles/How-can-I-make-my-users-and-customers-see-Confluence-pages/ba-p/869672])
# Paste the text on the comment box.

h3. Expected Results

It only shows the name of the attachment the same as the old view.

h3. Actual Results

The attachments are added in the comment and it fails to load.

h3.Workaround
Disable the new view by going to Profile picture > Personal Settings > Disable the Jira Labs.
fields.summary: When pasting a text with images as a comment on the new issue view the attachments fail to load and the comment can't be added

fields.description:
When navigating to Jira cloud, users may type the URLs directly into the browser address bar. In some URLs (/browse/issuekey), lowercase is accepted and will redirect to the uppercased address. In some URLs (/projects/pkey), lowercase is not accepted. 

Non-technical users who are not familiar with the uppercase nature of project keys may find themselves incorrectly typing the wrong URL address in lowercase. (ie. see JRACLOUD-71617)


Suggestion :
Have a more consistent upper and lower case URL addressing. If lowercase is not allowed, Jira should not accept the incorrect casing everywhere. If its allowed, the incorrect lowercases should automatically redirect to the correct uppercased address.
fields.summary: Consistent upper and lower case address for navigations
Issue update REST endpoint does not accept AccountID

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Copy Value From Other Field" post-function does not work for the "due date" field 
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare a date picker type custom field
# In the Edit the workflow screen, add the post-function *Copy Value From Other Field* on the *Create* transition
 !スクリーンショット 2019-02-25 17.04.19.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a post function to copy the value of 1 to "due date".
# Click the plus icon in the sidebar. set a value for field 1 and create

h3. Expected Results
 * due date field has a value set

h3. Actual Results
 * due date remains empty

h3. Notes:
* This issue is similar with [JRACLOUD-68751|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68751], which turned out to be an intended feature and was fixed to not to show up "Status" field, in [JRACLOUD-67714|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67714]. If this behavior of the due date is also an intended one, it'll be great that the same fix will be implemented.
 
h3. Workaround
* Create a custom field for due date(date picker type) and use that field as an alternative
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" does not work for the "due date" field on the "Create" transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Show dual timezone to prevent confusions for users from other locations

h3. Workaround
Create a time field with a description of a fix timezone to use (eg. UTC)
fields.summary: Dual Timezone dates on Jira Issues

fields.description:
h3. Description
When adding a code block using Fabric Editor (present on the *New Jira issue View*), the space reserved for typing the language syntax to be highlighted is cutting off a small part of the letters.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open Jira using *Mozilla Firefox*
# Create a *new comment*
# Add a *code block*
# Type any of the letters *g,j,p,q,y*

h3. Expected result
The code block will not cut off any parts of the letters typed
* This is the behavior in Chrome
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 3.21.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual result
Some letters have their bottom part cut off
* This is the behavior in Firefox
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 3.21.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Code Block Language Box Size Incorrect

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

If you're using the old issue view and accessing an issue in the Issue Detail View and you move the issue to a different status in the board, the Issue Detail View is not automatically updated. The system will update the information in the Issue Detail View if you click over the issue again.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Every time an action is taken in the board the system should update the Issue Detail View automatically.

h3. *Why this is important*

It's important because you're performing changes in the board and the system is displaying old information in the Issue Detail View, which may cause confusion.
fields.summary: Update the Issue Detail View every time an action is taken in the board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a User, I would like to be able to use "Advanced Search" in the "For issues that match this filter" section in the Slack Integration.

h3. Expected Results

Have the possibility to use "Advanced Search".

h3. Actual Results

There is no "Advanced" filtering in the section which has "For issues that match this filter".
fields.summary: Have the Option to "Advanced Search" in the "For issues that match this filter" Section

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a User, I would like to be able to have more than a single rule per project/channel in the Slack Integration.

h3. Expected Results

Have the possibility to add more than one single rule per project/channel combination.

h3. Actual Results

You can only have a single rule per project/channel combination
fields.summary: I would like to have the Option to Have more than a Single Rule per project/channel combination

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Direct navigation to project issues URL generates an incorrect "Internal Server Error".



h3. Steps to Reproduce

Project issues URL : https://<site>a.atlassian.net/projects/<PROJECT_KEY>/issues

- Use the project issues URL in the browser address bar. 
- Try a project key in lowercase
- Try a non-existing project key

h3. Expected Results

Jira should return the proper message that the project does not exist (or permission error).

 !correct message.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Incorrect internal server error returned. 

 !internal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect Internal Server Error on project issues URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* As a Jira administrator I disabled the outgoing mail feature on my cloud site, however, I'm still receiving notifications.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

* These notifications are specifically received from next-gen projects. 
* The change to outgoing mail feature is not getting applied to next-gen projects. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to cloud_site/secure/admin/OutgoingMailServers.jspa
# Disable the feature. 
# Go to a next gen project, try to trigger a notification by creating a new Jira issue and assigning it to a user. 

h3. Expected Results

No email notification is sent. 

h3. Actual Results

An email notification is sent.
 
h3. Notes
This can be considered as related to report [JSWCLOUD-17157|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17157]. 

h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no valid workaround yet.
fields.summary: Disabling Outgoing Mail is not applied when Jira email batching is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have a Next-gen project and create a custom field when performing a *basic* search filtering for that *Custom Field*, the following message is returned: "Field is not applicable to the current project and/or issue type".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This video shows that the search works before creating the next-gen project, but it doesn't after creating it.

# Create a Next-gen project
# Go to the Next-gen project > Project settings > Issue Types
# Create a new field
# Try searching for issues using that Custom Field on Basic Search

h3. Expected Results

You are able to select the Custom Field on the Basic Search.

h3. Actual Results

A warning is shown on the UI: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type".

h3. Notes

This seems to happen because Jira is mistaken the global issue type with the next-gen issue type.

h3.Workaround

Using Advanced search to search for the Custom Field.
fields.summary: Searching for a custom field on Next-gen projects breaks basic search

fields.description:
*Summary:*

Push notifications do not appear from the Jira Mobile app when the following is done by/to a Jira Service Desk issue:
 * Issue Created
 * Automation rules (Alert User, Set Default Assignee)
fields.summary: Push notifications do not appear for events performed on Jira Service Desk issues

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

It won't be possible to save the content in the description or in the comment if there is a code block in a bullet list, or in a numbered list.

h3. *Steps to reproduce*

* Start a bullet list (or a numbered list);
* Start a code block in the same item of a bullet list item, or below it;
* Try to save;

See the recording:  [^Cannot save the content.mp4] 

h3. *Expected Results*

The content will be saved.

h3. *Actual Results*

It is not possible to save the content, and the following message(s) will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 11.30.47.png|thumbnail!   !Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 11.31.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Workaround*

That format works in the old view.

*Turning off the new view:*
* Profile icon -> *Personal settings*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 09.57.24.png|thumbnail! 
* Turn off the *Jira Labs* feature:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 09.57.35.png|thumbnail! 

*PS.* The new issue view can only be turned off to Software project. Business projects will remain in the new one.
fields.summary: Can't save description/comment in the new issue view if there is a code block inside a bullet list or a numbered list

fields.description:
Following the steps described [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Set-first-day-of-week-to-Monday-on-calendar-widget/qaq-p/632394] does not reflect when using the new issue view.

*Workaround:*
There is no current workaround
fields.summary: Setting Monday as the first day of the week does not work on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users mentioned by their account id instead of user name will not receive email notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# @mention someone in an issue comment.
# Check if the mention had the format [~accountid:xxxxxxxxxx]


h3. Expected Results

The mentioned user receives the mention notification.

h3. Actual Results

No notification is fired.
 
h3. Notes

- Currently, only Jira mobile uses the [~accountid:xxxxx]  mention format.
- It is only possible to see the @mention format by editing the ticket on the old issue view.
fields.summary: Account ID user mentions won't trigger email notifications.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Attachments icon does not appear when in Polish language.
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue:
 # Click on your avatar on the bottom left corner > *Personal Settings*
 # From the drop-down menu, select Language as *Polish*.
 # Click on “*+*” button to create an issue.
 # The create issue screen does not have the attachment icon.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 6.27.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:

Use EN language instead of Polish(PL) language.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Add the attachment icon to the create issue screen in Polish language.
h3. Why this is important:

It is difficult to use the Polish language without the attachment icon.
fields.summary: Attachments icon do not appear when in Non-English language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to use the option "Log Time" in the New Issue View is not working, unless you click in the "Show More", to load all the fields

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA issue
# Click on the "..." button and then "Log Time"

h3. Expected Results
It should open the Time Tracking pop-up.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't, without throwing any error.

h3. Workaround
There are two workarounds:
	- Click on the "Show More" option, so the pop-up will be loaded;
	- Disable the New Issue View.
fields.summary: The Option "Log Time" is not Working Correctly in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h5. Problem
It's possible to link 2 Jira instances via AppLinks and link existing issues but it's not possible to create issues in the linked application.

h5. Suggested solution
To be able to create issue remotely
fields.summary: Create issues in remote Jira instance via AppLinks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62343].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently REST API for [edit issue|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.1.9/#api/2/issue-editIssue] and similar requires _field_id_  as a parameter. 
Eg:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -upass:pass -X PUT -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{"fields": { "customfield_11000": "1" } }' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/issue/PRG-11

< HTTP/1.1 204 No Content
{code}
And using CustomField _name_ doesn't work:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -upass:pass -X PUT -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{"fields": { "readonly-fields": "1" } }' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/issue/PRG-11

< HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"readonly-fields":"Field 'readonly-fields' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."}}
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow using CustomField _name_ as a parameter for REST API calls. 
This will allow the sharing of any REST API call across any platform as soon as same CustomField  exist into these platforms.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use REST API call to get the mapping
* api/2/issue/<issueIdOrKey>/editmeta 
** https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/issue/JRA-62343/editmeta
* rest/api/2/field
** https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/field
fields.summary: REST API: Allow to use name of Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to have the option to disable the new notifications format - explained [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing].

h3. Expected Results

Have the option to disable the new notifications format.

h3. Actual Results

There isn't an option to do disable
fields.summary: Add possibility to Disable the New Notifications Format

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When working with Jira and Confluence integrated if a single issue is retrieved in a Confluence page with a macro like the [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html], the issue itself will have a field "*mentioned in*" in which will have a link to the Confluence page that the issue is linked. However, if the Jira issues macro uses a JQL to retrieve more than one Jira issue in Confluence, the issue in Jira will not be pointing the specific page.

*Original description (from the Server edition)*

{quote}
# JIRA issues do not contain the field "mentioned in" which shows the confluence pages that have a link to that issue. 
# This only happens when the Confluence page includes a Jira filter which results are more than one issue.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence and Jira installed in your Cloud application.
# Create a few issues in a JIRA project (ROCK in this example) 
# Create a page in Confluence 
# Insert the JIRA issue macro using JQL search which returns multiple issues for example:
{code}
project = TEST
{code}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The added JIRA issue should display the "mentioned in" information on the Issue Links section of the JIRA Issue view screen.

h3. Actual Results
The Issue Links section does not display at all.
 
h3. Notes
If there is only one issue returned on the JQL search for the JIRA Issue Macro, the "mentioned in" information on the Issue Links section works as expected. For example : 
{code}
project = TEST AND status=Done
{code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro with more than 1 issue in Confluence does not link the page to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Remaining estimate is not updated when the Original estimate is filled on the issue

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud with the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the new issue view on the *Profile Settings*
# Add *Time Tracking* to the issue's edit screen
# Create a new issue
# Open the issue and enter a value on *Time estimate*

h3. Expected Results
*Remaining estimate* receives the same value as *Time estimate*

h3. Actual Results
*Remaining estimate* is not updated
 
h3. Workaround
This specifically happens on the new issue view only. You can either permanently disable the new issue view on your *Personal Settings* or temporarily with the *See the old view* button
fields.summary: Re-occurrence of JRACLOUD-71004 - Remaining estimate is not updated when original estimate is filled on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting images from external sources no longer working when using the new issue view. This could be reproduced on both Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox

h3. Environment
* Jira New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in the new issue view
# *Copy an image* from the web (*Right click > Copy Image*)
# Edit the "Description" field or add a new comment
# Use keyboard shortcut (*Ctrl + V*) to paste the image or *Right click > Paste*

h3. Expected Results
In the old view, the following popup is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-20 at 11.31.12 AM.png|thumbnail!

If the *Upload* button is clicked, the screenshot is automatically added to the issue and a thumbnail is generated in the field that is being edited

h3. Actual Results
A "Failed to load" message is presented:
*  !Screen Shot 2019-02-20 at 11.19.08 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* When attaching files use the *Attachment icon*
fields.summary: Pasting Images to Text Fields in the New Jira Issue View no longer works

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update}
This is now pushed to production!!
{panel}


h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to print/export an issue in new issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to print/export an issue in new issue view.

h3. Why this is important
Customers having the new issue view should be able to print/export an issue.

Old Issue View:
 !Screenshot 2019-02-20 at 16.38.03.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to print/export an issue in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Cannot navigate through successive images in an issue comment.
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be great to have an arrow to navigate through the images in a comment. This feature is available if we access the images from the attachment section but not when we access them from a comment.
h3. Workaround

Currently the only way to go to the next image is to close the current one and open the next.
fields.summary: Navigate through images in a comment by an arrow

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Stride gadget currently still show on JIRA tickets despite the absence of integration. 

 !Selection_444.bmp|thumbnail! 

This bug is mostly visual and do not cause any side effects. 

h3.Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this but our internal team is aware of this and is working with our developers to remove the Stride gadget from all affected Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Stride and Hipchat gadgets still showing on JIRA tickets despite integration removal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Issue History on both the new and old issue views don't have pagination, that means Jira needs to *render all history items at once* when loading them. This can become a performance problem if you have too many items.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add pagination to issue history 

h3. Why this is important 
When issues have too many items on this, it may not load
fields.summary: Add pagination to the issue history

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a feature to expire accounts for inactivity after a period of time? 

If a user hasn't used an account in a set amount time it would mark the account as inactive and eventually remove it if not logged in. The account inactivity would be set at a site wide level and not on specific users.
fields.summary: User Account Expiration Period

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we mention a user (by typing @user) in any issue comment field using the Jira app (iOS and Android) the tagged user does not get an email notification. However if we tag the same user using the Jira Browser version in the same issue comment, he/she receives an email notification 

h3. Investigation Done

Replicated this internally as well as on customer's instance both for ios and android Jira app


h3. Please Help With

Need help in fixing this issue i.e. irrespective of whether the user has been mentioned using the Jira app or Jira Browser they should receive an email notification of the tag.

This will create uniformity between the app and the browser version of Jira
fields.summary: Jira Mobile app- Tagged user does not receive a notification

fields.description: There isn't any documentation on to perform JSON import with EPIC link relation. It would be great to have specific documentation that describes the steps to perform the operation similar to CSV import documentation.
fields.summary: JSON import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now there isn't any built-in methods to have some sort of excerpt functionality in Jira Cloud, especially if the information that we are looking for is from Confluence. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we could use the excerpt-include macro from Confluence in Jira, so we can grab the information we want easily and directly.
fields.summary: Be able to use the excerpt-include macro from Confluence in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sort issues based on Severity for Jira ops

h3. Why this is important 

In the open issue page for Jira ops, the incidents are sorted based on the date created. There are requirements when the issues should be sorted based on priority.

This will help the users to better prioritize the issues and get them fixed.
fields.summary: Sort issues based on Severity for Jira ops

fields.description:
Atlassian is moving to the new Jira issue view. When viewing all issues on a site in detail view, the screen shows the old Jira issue view. This can be confusing to users who have had no experience with the old issue view mostly because the new issue view shows status to move to while the old issue view shows the transitions to the status.

Please update the issue detail view to match the new Jira issue view for uniformity.
fields.summary: Issue detail view shows old Jira issue view

fields.description: At the moment the cascading list box has one name. It would be great if we allowed to name the drop downs separately. For example if we have a version/build number list managed by the field then the name of the first drop down will be "version" and the next "build number".
fields.summary: Add ability to name each drop down of the cascading select list.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, while you're creating an issue and you select a user in a User Picker (Single User) custom field, the system will display the username instead of the full name.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

The system should display the Full Name when you select a user in the User Picker (Single User) custom field instead of the username like it does in other user fields like Reporter, Assignee and User Picker (Multiple Users).
fields.summary: Display the full name instead of the username in a User Picker (Single User) custom field while you're creating an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Uploaded image for project: 'Jira Cloud (including JIRA Core)'	
Jira Cloud (including JIRA Core)JRACLOUD-71583
Typing 'c' while browsing a list field takes the user to the create screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Edit a workflow transition, add a validator - Field Value Required, on the next screen you'll see a LIST of all your fields, including custom field. Think of one that has a C in it, and start typing. When you get to the C, you'll be bumped onto the Create Issue screen.
 [^create bug.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
The field should search for a value starting with 'c'

h3. Actual Results
The create issue screen shows up. The shortcut for creating issues should not work while a field is selected

h3.Workaround
No Workaround.
fields.summary: Typing 'c' while browsing a list field takes the user to the create screen

fields.description:
On the desktop version of Jira I have a Harvest widget that allows me to log my time against the ticket. Can this widget support be added to mobile experience?

!image-2019-02-18-08-05-26-358.png|width=496,height=193!
fields.summary: iPad Pro Mobile App Supports Harvest Widget Plugin

fields.description:
I am using the new 2018 iPad Pro and when in the mobile app I don't have the same ticket options as I do on the desktop. Can you please add the same ticket functions, especially log work, attach files, and create linked issue ticket?

Desktop list of functions

!image-2019-02-18-07-58-19-903.png|width=118,height=337!   

Mobile list of functions

!image-2019-02-18-07-58-54-923.png|width=521,height=364!
fields.summary: iPad Pro Mobile App Supports Same Ticket Functions as Desktop

fields.description: It would be useful if an ability to indent filter and highlight parenthesis when using Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to  automatically indent filter and highlight parenthesis

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to allow a group to create issues of a particular issue type in a project. There could be multiple issue type but the users would be allowed to only create issues of particular issue type(s).

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to allow a group to create issues of a particular issue type in a project. 

h3. Why this is important
Customers should be able to allow a group to create issues of a particular issue type in a project.
fields.summary: Ability to allow a group create issues of a particular issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Jira Server, the attachments file names might have appended to the file ID the original file name of the file(from when the file was uploaded).
For example when I attach a file named "picture.png" to a Jira issue, in the Jira Server's file system the file is stored with the ID of the file it gets in the database, like "12345", but on some cases the name of the original file might be appended to the file ID like "12345_pincture.png".

Depending on the size of the name of the original file, this name might exceed the 255 characters limit and the import will fail silently.
h3. Environment
Jira Server importing into Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a file with more than 255 characters in its name
# Import this file into Jira Cloud using the "Import attachments" option.

h3. Expected Results
The file is imported
h3. Actual Results
The importer fails silently in the browser (it just reloads the page).
 
h3. Notes
In the micros_zipper logs we can see this message:
{noformat}Callback to notify failure, details: Unable create file from a buffer. Failure: Failure{cause=null, reason=BAD_STATUS, message='{"error":{"code":"BadRequestError","title":"Request failed to validate against RAML definition: invalid query (maxLength, 255) for parameter name"}}', httpStatusCode=400}{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Identify which file has this big name and rename it to just the file ID.
Re-zip maintaining the folder structure and retry the import.

This is also valid for the "thumbs" file within the "thumbs" folder, so make sure to update the file name of the thumbs as well (or simply remove the "thumbs" folder).
fields.summary: Import attachments with big file names fail silently

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67668].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Activity Stream shows users previous activities in JIRA. Some users would like to be able to export the activity record in a specific duration. to PDF/Word file/Excel file. 

This would be useful for users/Admin because as per GDPR, users should be allowed to export their own activity history as well.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Activity Stream to be exportable and add an option of specific date interval which user can export.


h3. Workaround 

Manually expand the Activity Stream by clicking on "Show more" and save the content of the Activity Stream to an MS file.
fields.summary: Allow user to export Activity Stream

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator, I'd like to choose which fields should appear on the body of the issue and which field should appear on the right column. 

Currently, you can only choose which fields will appear first on the right column and which should appear on *show more*. But would be nice to have the ability to display some fields on the body of the issue.
fields.summary: Ability to change the position of fields on the New Issue View

fields.description:
Feature Request:

h3. Problem Definition

Custom Field of Type URL is not clickable on Jira iOS app

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Create a Custom field of type URL in Jirs
2. Put a web link in this field while creating an issue e.g. https://adc.com
3. When using the Android Jira cloud app from Atlassian, the web-link field is "clickable" which means when a user clicks the field, the browser is opened at the address in the field. 4.This does not work on the iPhone Jira Cloud app from Atlassian. This field is not clickable

However if we put the same web link in a default field like Description, the weblink is clickable on the iOS app.


h3. Actual result

Web links should be clickable and should open in the phone's native browser.

h3. Expected result

Weblinks are not shown as hyperlinks however are shown as plain text

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet
fields.summary: Custom Field of Type URL is not clickable on Jira iOS app

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As of now, a welcome page is displayed for all new users joining the instance. If the welcome page is not required, site-admins should be given the ability/choice to disable the page entirely.
fields.summary: Allow site-admins to disable welcome page on user onboarding

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When having a board tied to service desk project, opening a service desk issue from the board will open it using the new Jira issue view. Once the issue is opened in the pop-up, selecting *[...]* > Configure will redicted to the "Issue layout" configuration page. Because this "Issue layout" setting does not exist in a Jira Service Desk project settings, it will display as a blank page.

h3. Environment
# "New Jira issue view for software projects" enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board located in a Service desk project
# Select one of the issues to open the issue in the new Jira issue view
# Select *[...]* > Configure


h3. Expected Results
# You should redirected to the "Issue layout" configuration page in the project's settings

h3. Actual Results
# You will be redirected to a blank page with the following URL: <instance>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_name>/issuelayout?screenId=<id> because the "Issue layout" is not a configuration found in a service desk project settings.
fields.summary: Selecting "Configure" option in a service desk ticket opened from a board will redirect to a blank "Issue layout" page
Creating an EPIC via REST v3 returns Operation value must be an object error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to configure fields on the new issue view for Classic JIRA Service Desk projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban board and associate with a JIRA Service Desk *Classic* project
# Open an issue on the board and choose ... > Configure.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to configure the fields.

h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to a blank page as the classic project it does not has the new _issue layout_ for field configuration.

When you click on configure you are redirected to:
{noformat}
https://INSTANCE_URL.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/PKEY/issuelayout?screenId=ID
{noformat}
fields.summary: Not able to configure fields on the new issue view for Classic JIRA Service Desk projects

fields.description:
Currently in Jira, if a user has access to an issue, this user will see all the issue linked on this issue, even though the user doesn't have access to the issue linked. 

It only displays the issue key, but Jira should hide these links if a user doesn't have access to this issue.
fields.summary: Hide Issue Links from issues that a user doesn't have permission to access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With special characters like the dot "*.*" is in the Release name, this makes searching on the *Fix Version* field inconsistent as it will not pick up on partial searches.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Release named "Release 01.14.51" (quotes not included)
# Add the *Fix Version* field to your search

The results go as follows depending on which part of the name used for partial searches:

- Release 01.14.51 = matches (/)
- 01. = matches (/)
- 01.14.51 = matches (/)
- .14 = no matches (x)
- .51 = no matches (x)
- .14.51 = no matches (x)

 !Issue_navigator_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

Using the same Release name just without the dot this time picks up the *Fix Version* regardless which part of the name is used:

- Release 01 14 51 = matches (/)
- 14 = matches (/)
- 14 51 = matches (/)
- 51 = matches (/)

 !Issue_navigator_pace.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Searching on Fix Version field is inconsistent with special characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When checking issues in a Sprint on Jira Mobile (iOS or Android) it displays a different amount of issues when seeing on Jira Web (Desktop).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new project with one or more Sprints and a Backlog;
# Create 1000+ issues;
# Split them between the backlog and the Sprints;

h3. Expected results

You should see the same amount of issues on the mobile app (iOS or Android) that you have on the web version (Desktop).

h3. Actual results

The values are different between the mobile and the web version.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.able.
fields.summary: When checking backlog on mobile version the amount of issues is different from the web version.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
External system import of Trello board to Jira fails when the comments of the board contain a user who does not exist on the Trello board.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Trello board Delete a user who has made a comment
# Go to Jira System setting> External system import> Trello import
# Follow the import process through

h3. Expected Results
The board should be imported to Jira as a project
 
h3. Actual Results
The import fails to complete

h3 Error
{code}
Import logs 
ERROR - Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state:

Backend logs
 IllegalStateException error
{code}

h3. Note
This is different from the bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70113 which throws a similar error.

h3. Workaround
Add the removed user back on the Trello board and perform the import again.
fields.summary: Trello import to Jira fails when comments contain deleted user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to clone a Jira issue a progress bar is supposed to show up to follow the operation progress. 

Intermittently, the progress bar is getting stuck (screenshot). However, searching in the project we can see that the Jira issue was indeed cloned. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The behavior is intermittent. 

h3. Expected Results
Progress bar finish till the end then an *"ack"* button shows up. 


h3. Actual Results
* The progress bar get stuck but the Jira issue is cloned in the background. (it can be found when searching inside the project)
* The progress bar finish and the *ack* button does not show up, we get directly redirected to the newly cloned issue. 
* The progress bar does not show up at all and we get directly redirected to newly cloned issue. 
 
h3. Temporary workaround

Search in the project if the Jira issue got cloned otherwise try the process again
fields.summary: Progress Bar for clone or bulk move is getting stuck intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira administrator I'm using the People feature and I created some teams.
Now, I would like to use REST API to access teams info and analyze teams-related data. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide publicly available REST API endpoints to access this data.

h3. Why this is important
Data analysis
fields.summary: Provide REST API endpoints to manipulate data related to People and Teams

fields.description:
h3. Description:
When a custom icon is defined for a priority, notifications that display this icon present a broken image instead of the avatar.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access the priorities page https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
# Edit an existing priority / Create a new priority
# Update its *Icon URL* and define an external image
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-13 at 8.01.22 PM.png|thumbnail!  
# Save the priority
# Create an issue that uses the priority
!Screen Shot 2019-02-13 at 8.02.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior:
The priority icon is displayed in the notification

h3. Actual behavior:
The icon is not displayed as expected. Instead, a broken image is shown
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-13 at 8.02.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom Priority Icons are not displayed in email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira doesn't have the condition/validator to check the link of the issues. Example: Is there an article/issue linked with the current issue? If no, the user should not able to transition the issue to the next status.

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have a Workflow validator/condition that allows us to restrict users to transition the issue only if there is a link to an issue or a Confluence page.

h3. Why this is important
* This way we would make sure that before closing the ticket our users have linked the ticket to a KB article.
* Make sure the user had linked the related issues before proceeding with the next step.
fields.summary: Workflow condition/validator for Linked Article/Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to select users from user filter popup in multiple user picker field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to select users from user filter popup in multiple user picker field, instead of typing the initial characters of the users to display it.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to select users from user filter popup in multiple user picker field
fields.summary: Ability to select users from user filter popup in multiple user picker field

fields.description:
It would be great if the search bar run as soon as I leave the JQL search field instead of searching it only when I click enter or click in the search button.

It would avoid the confusion of keeping displaying previous results when I have typed a different JQL search.
fields.summary: Search for JQL query as soon as leave the search field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
TLS encryption for data in transit is good, but it is not enough.  We need more than physical controls and management for data at rest security. 


h3. Suggested Solution

*As a* cloud user

*I want* all of my Atlassian cloud data encrypted at rest

*So that* it is protected in the event of a security breach.

h3. Why this is important

 My opinion is that encryption at rest is something that should be a standard for vendors offering hosted services.  I would like to request this feature be added to Jira Cloud

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Encrypt data at rest in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new issue view, the "*[~*" prefix for prompting the *Mentions* feature no longer works. This means that the only way to bring up the *Mentions* window is with the "*@*" prefix or with the editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On any mentionable field (ie: comments) type [~

h3. Expected Results

In the old view, the *Mentions* window would pop up with a list of users to tag which would be expected in the new view as well

 !_KAN-102__Test_Belto_Ellis_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
 
h3. Notes

This is strictly in the new issue view. Using the "@" prefix instead works as expected in both new and old view. Manually inputting the proper markup for the *Mention* function will simply be added as plain text.

 !_KAN-102__Test_Belto_Ellis_-_JIRAtest.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

No actual workaround, use "@" instead.
fields.summary: Mentions prefix does not work in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The webhooks are currently not correctly honoring the conditions with attachments. If the user creates two webhooks (with each webhook targeting its own specific project) and both webhooks have the attachment conditions checked, attaching an attachment to any issuetype will trigger both webhooks regardless of the project that the issue was created in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two webhooks targeting different projects in the JQL query conditions
 ## For example: 1 webhook should have JQL query: project = ABC, the other webhook will have: project = DEF
 # Both webhooks should have conditions selected:
 ## Attachments:"created" and "deleted" selected.
 ## Issue: "created" and "updated" selected.
 ## Comment: "created" and "updated" selected
 # Both webhooks should be enabled
 # Go to one of your projects specific in your webhooks and create an issue. Attach an attachment
 # Notice that once an attachment is attached, both webhooks will trigger even when the attachment is not on that specific project

h3. Expected Result
When attaching an attachment, the webhook in which the issue/attachment resides should only be the one triggering. All other webhooks should not trigger according to its conditions.
fields.summary: Adding an Attachment to an Issue Triggers all Webhooks with the Attachment Condition Selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When deleting an application link in Jira Cloud the warning message that pops up is the same as the Jira server version and is applicable to the same. The warning is confusing for the Cloud users.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete an Application link in Jira Cloud
# Go through the warning message

h3. Expected Results
A better-informed warning message for the Jira Cloud environment.

h3. Actual Results
The below warning message is displayed.
{noformat}
You are about to delete the selected application link. Deleting an application link will remove all per-user authentication tokens. If you re-add the application link to this server in the future, each of your users will be forced to authorize again. Are you sure you want to continue?
{noformat}
fields.summary: Deleting application links shows a warning applicable to Jira Server

fields.description:
QuickSearch is using [this|#api-api-2-search-post] REST endpoint. We see these error messages in our logs.

[“Field 'summary' does not exist or this field cannot be viewed by anonymous users.",
 "Field 'description' does not exist or this field cannot be viewed by anonymous users.”]

OR

[“Field 'summary' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.",
 "Field 'description' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.”]

and it comes back with 400 status code.

Our problem with this is, that we can't distinguish from real "bad request". I think this kind of problem can be communicated better with the 403 status code "forbidden".
fields.summary: The REST API operation on POST /rest/api/2/search reject with 400 instead of a 403

fields.description:
h3. Description
When the username is updated we need to use quotation marks in issue navigator search

h3. Steps to reproduce
Have the username changed 
Assign a ticket
If you run an advanced search based on the assignee, it will require the quotation marks
If you didn't change the username, it does not require the quotation marks.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: When the username is updated we need to use quotation marks in issue navigator search

fields.description:
The workflow property *jira.permission.create.clone.denied* is not available for Jira Cloud.

[Workflow properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/workflow-properties-776636709.html]

The add-on *Issue Operations Plugin* has the module *View Issue Ops Bar Clone Link*, this module controls the *Clone button*, however, it is not possible to disable this module on Jira Cloud.

[Disable Clone Issue in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-clone-issue-in-jira-747836996.html]

Please create a new feature that will let administrators disable the *Clone* feature on Jira Cloud.
 
h5. Workaorund
Using the property jira.permission.createclone.denied and set the value to true, it should work.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA administrators to disable the clone feature.

fields.description:
Hi, 

With the new view, when I try to modify time logged, I've got to go to the issue and see it with the old view to manage the edition. I suggest that the time logg could be managed in the issue in the board, not going to the issue settings. 

It would be useful taking into account that a lot of people in the Atlassian Community do not like the new view. 

 

Best regards
fields.summary: Time tracking edition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is being assigned an issue, he/she receives push notification in iOS mobile app even if the user is not notification recipient for "Issue Assigned" event in the notification scheme.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* iOS JIRA application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that user is not a recipient for *Issue Assigned* event in the project's notification scheme
# Login as the user into iOS JIRA application
# Assign an issue to the user. Ensure that the user has access to the issue

h3. Expected Results
User does not receive any email or push notification (in mobile app) as he/she is not a recipient for *Issue Assigned* event

h3. Actual Results
User will receive a push notification in mobile app with following information:
* Push notification template:
{panel}
<issue-key> <summary>
 Assigned to you by <user-who-performed-the-action>
{panel}
* For example:
{panel}
*TEST-123 This is issue summary*
Assigned to you by Yahya Rahimi
{panel}

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Issue assignee receives push notification for issue assigned event regardless of notification settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to have the option to check the history of searches that I shared with other users.

 !Search Shared.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Have the option to check the history of searches.

h3. Actual Results

There isn't an option to check the searches that I shared.
fields.summary: Have the Option to Check the History of Searches Shared

fields.description:
When a Jira administrator visits the installed add-ons (apps) and wants to *Watch* an app, the *Start watching* button does not work correctly, as after a page refresh, it still reads *watch app* instead of *stop watching*

Steps to reproduce:
 * Visit the Apps section of a Jira Cloud site
 * Click to expand one of the installed apps (add-ons)
 * Click on "Watch app" button 
 * Refresh the page
 * Look at the "Watch app" button: it still reads *Watch app*, instead of *stop watching*
fields.summary: cannot watch app (add-on)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the kanban board, if you click on an issue the card view fails to render properly

h3. Environment
OS: Windows 7
Browser: IE 11.0.9600.19236

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any kanban board (software or business)
# Click an issue 
# Close issue
# Now open the issue again

h3. Expected Results
The card view renders the issue
 
h3. Actual Results
The card fails to render

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to refresh the page.
fields.summary: Issues fail to render in IE11 when viewing cards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Default users for the role "atlassian-addons-project-access" can access next-gen private projects. However, since this role cannot be managed on the _People_ page, the users access to the project cannot be revoked.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira user and add it as a default member for the role "atlassian-addons-project-access"
# Create a next-gen private project
# Log into Jira using the user created on the step #1 and try to access the project created on the step #2

h3. Expected Results

The user cannot access the project OR his user can be found on _People_ page 

h3. Actual Results

The user can access the project normally and the permission cannot be revoked

h3. Notes

When a new project is created, it will be assigned these 'default members' for the 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role. Note that 'default members' apply only when a project is created. Changing the 'default members' for a project role will not affect role membership for existing projects.

h3. Workaround

Remove the user from the 'default members' for the 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role, create a new next-gen project and move the issues from the current affected project to the newly created project
fields.summary: Default users for the role "atlassian-addons-project-access" can access next-gen private projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A next-gen project owner or administrator should be able to select a category from the predefined ones to assign it to their project. However, to assign a category to the project the user requires "Administer Jira" global permission in Jira.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project
# Try changing the project category from the user who is not part of the groups under "Administer project" permission.

h3. Expected Results
The category is set to the project.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown.
{noformat}
Couldn't update details - Your project is a bit special and you don't have permission to update its details. Contact your Jira admin for help
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
If this is the intended behaviour then we should disable the option for the user who does not have the appropriate permission.

h3.Workaround
Contact a Jira admin to change the category.
fields.summary: Next-gen Project owner/Administrator not able to set the project category

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In the User Management screen, the user search field is hiding some characters

h3. Todo
Review the User Management screen to ensure they're more responsive.

Screenshot where this is visible:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None at this time
fields.summary: User Management user search field is hiding characters

fields.description:
There is no way to identify an inactive user when looking at their profile page:

 !image-2019-02-08-19-58-57-427.png|thumbnail! 

User is inactive / No site access:

 !image-2019-02-08-19-59-47-555.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: There is no way to identify an inactive user when looking at their profile page

fields.description:
The new issue view is not identifying inactive users on the user picker fields, assignee, reporter and custom fields.

In this way, only site administrators can identify who is inactive on a Cloud site and it's not the case for most users contributing on Jira as developers or non-site administrator roles.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The new issue view is not identifying inactive users on the user picker fields

fields.description: As a customer it would be nice to forward logs from our Atlassian Cloud instance to Splunk, perhaps something in the admin section would be cool.
fields.summary: Allow customers to forward logs to splunk from Atlassian cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When copying a formatted text from Jira and pasting in another application, it is noticeable to have additional characters.

h3. *Environment*

Jira Cloud

h3. *Steps to reproduce*

* Type a text in a comment;
* Format one of its characters (e.g. bold, italic).

See the example:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 14.32.48.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 14.33.03.png|thumbnail! 

Here's a recording provided by the customer who reported the behaviour. It shows other applications (the first browser is Firefox):   [^zero-width char.mov] 

h3. *Workaround*

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Formatted text copied from issue contains Zero-width Unicode characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to create a header for Dashboards

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue

* Create a Dashboard
* Add a few fields in it based on my requirement and set the page length to
50 records per page.

h3. Actual Result
* If we scroll down the gadget to see the records the top header does not stick and we need to scroll up to see the column name which is inconvenient.


h3. Expected result

Ability to be able to add a header so that the Column name sticks to the top of the page, while a page is being scrolled.

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet
fields.summary: Ability to to create a header for Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Webhook for adding attachment doesn't update the Issue key in the response
 !Screenshot 2019-02-08 at 3.34.32 PM.png|thumbnail!

But adding a comment does provide the issue key in the response.
 !Screenshot 2019-02-08 at 3.40.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
* Create a webhook to add an attachment
* Add an attachment to the issue
* capture the response
We can observe that no issue key is provided in the response.

h3. Workaround
Use \{issue.key\} pr \{issue.id\} query param value in the webhook URL as described in https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/webhooks/#variable-substitution-in-the-webhook-url
fields.summary: Webhook for adding attachment doesnot update the Issue key in the response

fields.description: It would be great if the JQL function allow parameters more flexible. For example, current 'linkedIssues()' only support issue key, or key and linktype. it is very much helpful to implement fields condition or etc like 'linkedIssues( XXX field = VVV)'. It makes users achieve more flexible and strong searching.
fields.summary: Add ability to support JQL function parameter more flexible

fields.description: Current 'linkedIssues()' only support issue key, or key and linktype. it is very much helpful to implement fields condition or etc like 'linkedIssues( XXX field = VVV)'. It makes users achieve more flexible and strong searching.
fields.summary: Allow field condition parameter in 'linkedissue()' JQL function

fields.description: It would be great if the JQL function allow parameters more flexible. For example, current 'linkedIssues()' only support issue key, or key and linktype. it is very much helpful to implement fields condition or etc like 'linkedIssues( XXX field = VVV)'. It makes users achieve more flexible and strong searching.
fields.summary: Add ability to support JQL function parameter more flexible

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when adding a comment in a Jira Slack channel that includes 5 Jira issue keys, only 4 issue will get unfurled. 

The limit is hard coded as 4 issue keys. 

h3. Suggested Solution 

Increase this limit and provide a settings to configure it. 

h3. Workaround 

Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Increase limit for Issue previews (unfurling) feature

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have quick filters for board search as we have for filter search.

At the filter search page, we have quick filters for Project, Owner, Groups to speed the search, it would be great if we have something like these quick filters for the Board Search page as well.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have quick filters for board search as we have for filter search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users access a notification or a most recent action on an issue where the URL leads to a focuzed comment, Jira will ignore the setting of the "New Jira Issue View" of the "Labs" section of the user profile and will display the issue in the "old" issue view. This is also applicable to Next-gen projects (where it is expected that only the "New Jira Issue View" is available).

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71521.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log in as a user on a Jira Cloud instance;
* Access a notification of a comment on an issue (for example);

h3. Expected Results
* Jira respects the user setting for the "New Jira Issue View" on the "Labs" section of the user profile.

h3. Actual Results
* The issue is opened in the "old" issue view.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Delete everything after (including) the ? in the URL (Although this will "unfocus" the comment of the issue).
fields.summary: Accessing a focuzed comment of an issue will take users to the "old view"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to change the status based on a field's value by a user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to change the status based on a field's value by a user.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to change the status based on a field's value by a user
fields.summary: Ability to change the status based on a field's value by a user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Development panel is missing on the new issue view if the issue belongs to a Business project.

* This is an issue from a business project which has a commit associated. The development panel is missing.
!Screen Shot 2019-02-06 at 19.34.31.png|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2019-02-06 at 19.34.59.png|thumbnail!  
* This is an issue from a software project which has a commit associated and the development panel is displayed.
!Screen Shot 2019-02-06 at 19.35.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud + New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with a Bitbucket account
# Create an issue on a Business project
# Create a commit on Bitbucket and mention the key of the issue created on step 2

h3. Expected Results
Development panel should list the related commits/pull requests/branches.

h3. Actual Results
Development panel is missing on the issues.
 
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view on _Profile settings_
fields.summary: Development panel is missing on the new issue view for Business projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Jira goes to the "Issue Layout" section of a project that he/she doesn't have the "Browse projects" permission, the "Issue Layout" section doesn't open, throwing a "We couldn't load the page. Check your network connection and try refreshing it. Try again." message.

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71518.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log in as a Jira admin;
* Select a project where you know you *don't* have the "Browse projects" permission, then click *settings*;
* Click *Issue layout*;
* Click on any issue type to edit the issue layout.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira opens the screen to edit the issue layout for that issue type.

h3. Actual Results
* The "Issue Layout" section doesn't open, throwing a "We couldn't load the page. Check your network connection and try refreshing it. Try again." message.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Give yourself the "Browse project" permission on that project.
fields.summary: If the Jira admin doesn't have "Browse projects" on the project, the Issue Layout doesn't open

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, the quick search on Jira is not returning dashboards on the results.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

It should be possible to return dashboards in the quick search.

h3. *Why this is important*

Dashboards are used frequently and returning it in the quick search would improve the user experience.
fields.summary: Quick Search should return Dashboards.

fields.description:
Can't identify inactive user as Project lead inside the project’s settings and list:

!image-2019-02-06-13-45-24-962.png|thumbnail!

!image-2019-02-06-13-49-42-342.png|thumbnail!

Charlie does not have site access, meaning he is an inactive user:

!image-2019-02-06-13-50-44-341.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't identify inactive user as Project lead inside the project’s settings and list

fields.description:
Hi,

I work A LOT (too much) and I don't want my staff or team to feel the need to work as much as I do. Work / Life balance is important! I'm hoping there's a way to configure Jira to hold email notifications during offline hours and only send them during the work day! That way I can work extra but everyone else can work the same.
fields.summary: Allow to pause Email Notifications during offline hours

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, it's not possible to generate a report of the users that never logged a worklog on Jira.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

We'd like to have a report to inform the users that never added hours on Jira, this report should not be based on a specific project but at all Jira.

h3. *Why this is important*

It's important to check users that have a license but are possibly not using Jira.
fields.summary: Report of users that never entered a worklog on Jira.

fields.description: h3. *Problem Definition* Component/s field with empty value that is being Bulk Moved from one Issuetype to another on the same Project and the component/s field is required in the field configuration throws an error. The error that is thrown on the Bulk move is due to the required field configuration, however there's no input field that is visible for a value to be entered. {panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5} - Go to your Field Configurations, create two different Field Configurations for each IssueType. example Task and Bug - Add that Field Configuration to your Field configuration Scheme, then associate that field configuration scheme to your Project. - First of all, make the component/s field optionals then create some issues - Create a Task without component field - Edit your Field configuration and make the component/s field "required" for both Issuetypes. - Search for these issues using the Issue Navigator. Example JQL below - {code:java} project = COM AND issuetype= Task AND status not in (Closed, Done) AND component is EMPTY {code} - Bulk Move this issues from One IssueType to another. - Error is thrown that the "Component/s field is required" without any input field.{panel} h3. *Expected Results* * Since the Component/s field is required, an input field should be visible, so a user can key in a value during the move. h3. *Actual Results* * The Component/s field is required without any Input field. checking on the Dev console shows the input field is hidden after being disabled {code:java} {code} * !components.png|thumbnail! h3. *Workaround* * Make the Component/s field optional from the *Field Configuration* for both Issuetypes.
fields.summary: Empty Component field returns "Field is required error" during Bulk Move
